films.title: Albert Gran. 117min. Digital 4K (restoration). Silent with English intertitles.
films.description: A disillusioned sewer worker and a down-on-her-luck street urchin hide from the authorities under the guise of a fake marriage, finding true love in the deception.

films.title: All That Heaven Allows
films.description: A Park Circus re-release Jane Wyman and Rock Hudson navigate social mores and their deepest desires in Douglas Sirk’s magnificent melodrama. TOO MUCH: MELODRAMA ON FILM 25 and Under: An Introduction to Melodrama Season curator Ruby McGuigan offers an introduction to this two-month season. films.title: AMY! + discussion with Laura Mulvey
films.description: + Frida Kahlo & Tina Modotti A shorts programme of Mulvey and Wollen’s works, repositioning the narratives of three women: Amy Johnson, Frida Kahlo and Tina Modotti.

films.title: Argentina 1984. Director María Luisa Bemberg. With Susú Pecoraro, Imanol Arias,
films.description: The true story of Argentine socialite Camila O’Gorman and her scandalous desire for a Jesuit priest, captured with empathy, heat and righteous anger. Obsession Love’s twisted relative, obsession takes root when the world will not bend to our wishes. Tales of unrequited love, impossible desires and toxic jealousy.

films.title: Book Launch: Terence Davies Screenplays, Volumes I and II
films.description: We explore Terence Davies’ written work with contributors from a new collection of his screenplays.

films.description: A hired gun changes his politics when he meets the beleaguered Cangaceiro bandits, in a Cannes-award-winning western that proved influential on Laura Mulvey and Peter Wollen.

films.description: a male-organised world.

films.title: Denmark 1996. Director Lars Von Trier. With Emily Watson, Stellan Skarsgård,
films.description: A man is permanently injured in an oil rig accident, leaving his adoring wife wracked with guilt, willing to do anything to restore her marriage and relationship with God. films.title: Disgraced Monuments + discussion with Laura Mulvey
films.description: + 23rd August 2008 In Mulvey and Lewis’s film, the repercussions of regime change in Russia through the 20th century finds complex articulation and negotiation through the creation and alteration of statues in the former Soviet Empire. films.title: Egypt 1959. Director Henry Barakat. With Faten Hamama, Ahmed Mazhar,
films.description: A young woman seeks revenge for the death of her sister, only to be drawn into the same complex web of intrigue, desire and manipulation that led to her downfall. Scandal The opinion of others can make or break us. Here are melodrama’s tragic heroines, who fall victim to its judgmental gaze.

films.title: Germany 1972. Director Rainer Werner Fassbinder. With Margit Carstensen,
films.description: A successful fashion designer finds her lavish apartment increasingly isolated as the object of her affections fails to return her devotion, in Fassbinder’s autobiographical masterpiece. films.description: A former sex-worker seeks a new life for herself and her son, only to find the past is not easily left behind, in this operatic tragedy anchored by Anna Magnani.

films.description: Inspired by the life of tanka poet Fumiko Nakajō, this is an unflinching and humane portrait of a woman transformed by her cancer diagnosis.

films.description: A farmer’s daughter comes of age through hardships of 1900s rural Scotland in Terence Davies’ lyrical adaptation of Lewis Grassic Gibbon’s novel.

films.description: Obsessive and irrational jealousy fuels the controlling behaviour of an abusive husband, whose veneer of respectability steadily erodes throughout this darkly-lined tragedy. films.description: 1982 film presents an at-once grounded yet heavily staged portrait of London, which was then in recession.

films.title: Spain 2006. Director Pedro Almodóvar. With Penélope Cruz, Carmen Maura,
films.description: A mother returns from the dead to confront unfinished business with her daughters, who are embroiled in their own emotional turmoil and entwined dramatics. films.description: Terence Davies was full of passion and light when he talked about cinema, as this programme reveals.

films.title: The Unrealised Projects of Terence Davies
films.description: Join us as we explore the range of films that Terence Davies didn’t get to make. Dear Bud: The Creative Mind of Terence Davies Edge Hill University, the repository of the Terence Davies Archive, curates a free exhibition of previously unseen materials from Davies’ personal archive and the archive of production company Hurricane Films.
